texts.label: paragraph
texts.orig: E-mailing a binary e-mail attachment from a Linux server has always been difficult for me because I never found a reliable method to get it done. I've used
texts.text: E-mailing a binary e-mail attachment from a Linux server has always been difficult for me because I never found a reliable method to get it done. I've used

texts.label: paragraph
texts.orig: on various systems but the attachment is often unreadable by many e-mail clients.
texts.text: on various systems but the attachment is often unreadable by many e-mail clients.

texts.label: paragraph
texts.orig: Someone finally showed me a simple, fool-proof method to send binary attachments reliably from various Linux systems:
texts.text: Someone finally showed me a simple, fool-proof method to send binary attachments reliably from various Linux systems:

texts.label: paragraph
texts.orig: If you e-mail doesn't arrive, remember to consider the size of the file that you're sending and the restrictions of the receiver's e-mail server. Keep in mind that encoding the binary attachment will cause the size of the e-mail to creep up a bit more (about 1.37x plus a little extra with  Base64 ).
